items.title: Why gradient Tape with tensor flow make the sum of the tensor?
items.body:
I'am testing gradient tape with tensorflow 2.0 and I don't understand the following behaviour My example:

import tensorflow as tf
print(tf.__version__)

x = tf.constant(3.0)
inc = tf.constant([1.,2.])

with tf.GradientTape() as t:
   t.watch(x)       
   y = x  * inc

dy_dx = t.gradient(y, x)

print(dy_dx)
print(y)
print(inc)

the output results is :

2.2.0
tf.Tensor(3.0, shape=(), dtype=float32)
tf.Tensor([3. 6.], shape=(2,), dtype=float32)
tf.Tensor([1. 2.], shape=(2,), dtype=float32)

if y = x * inc the results of dy_dx is only inc so [1. 2.]. I don't understand why it returns the sum of inc ? Thanks
